Title: Sr. Software Engineer
Job_Description:
Company Name: Kroger General Office
Position Type: Employee
FLSA Status: Exempt
Line of Business:
See what life is like at Kroger Technology
at https://www.kroger.com/livekt

Additional Technology Information: Senior Software Engineer - Customer Identity
Kroger's Customer Identity team's mission is to provide state of the art secure, low-friction, and
highly available authentication & authorization services for over 65 Million online shoppers. You
will be joining a team that is on a journey toward enabling passwordless auth, FIDO, and
passkeys.
You will be joining a CIAM (Customer Identity and Access Management) team that is highly
passionate about customer experience and developer experience. You will be responsible for
creating sign-up, login and identity management flows for Kroger applications (iOS, Android,
and Web). You will work on features such as multi factor auth with new device detection, code
challenge flows, and social sign in to provide a low friction and secure means of allowing
customers to access Kroger's services.
Our Tech Stack
What You'll Do
& web applications, as well as infrastructure services and components for customer
authentication
integration into our APIs and Auth flows
frame
What you'll need
ensure you are solving the right problems.

Title: Sr. Software Engineer
Job_Description:
Company Name: Kroger General Office
Position Type: Employee
FLSA Status: Exempt
Line of Business:
See what life is like at Kroger Technology
at https://www.kroger.com/livekt

Additional Technology Information:
Are you an engineers' engineer? Do you have experience and enjoy building tools, libraries, pipelines, software, and practices that accelerates and improves software development for yourself and others?

We are seeking a senior web platform software engineer to join the Kroger Application Platform Web Client (KWC) team. The KWC team uses the latest tech and concepts to more effectively handle shared dependencies among applications enterprise wide. This empowers library authors and application teams to better manage dependencies which improves velocity, reduces maintenance and support time, and improves the developer experience. In other words, we enable foundational capabilities integration via module federation: distributed shared dependency integration at enterprise scale.

This front-end quality engineering (QE) role will create and maintain automated test cases, executes test suites, review and diagnose reported bugs to ensures overall product quality prior during each product release cycle. During each sprint, this QE role will ensure test scenarios are considered during backlog refinement and sprint planning for our React and NodeJS web platforms (Content Management and Kroger.com).

Title: Sr. Software Engineer
Job_Description:
Company Name: Kroger General Office
Position Type: Employee
FLSA Status: Exempt
Line of Business: Enterprise Retail Systems
See what life is like at Kroger Technology
at https://www.kroger.com/livekt

Additional Technology Information:

The Advanced Software Engineering Manager is accountable for the engineering and operational aspects of the product, including the technology decisions, how well the team delivers on business priorities, value stream efficiency (how work gets done), and the performance of the product. The Software Engineering Manager owns the architecture, quality, and performance of the product. As such, the Software Engineering Manager must stay abreast of technology evolution and guide the team as a servant leader to make good product design decisions. You work with an attitude of "Quality is everyone's responsibility" and coach team to foster that as a way of working. You are an advocate of continuous testing and champion full stack Test automation. You bring thought leadership to Quality Engineering, own the Vision and Roadmap for the department and drive efforts to shift focus from defect detection to defect prevention. As a technical manager, you set the boundaries and expectations for delivering a quality product and timely solutions. You are an avid promoter of process improvement. You seek out and promote best practices. You own and refine the technical architecture, working with the team to continually refactor the product to eliminate technical debt and incorporate modern tools, languages, and engineering practices.

Title: Product Designer
Job_Description:
Company Name: Kroger General Office
Position Type: Employee
FLSA Status: Exempt

Position Summary

Lead experience design efforts for a critical portion of a user's journey by employing advanced design methods and creative problem-solving activities. Partner and collaborate with other product designers, product managers, technical leads and multi-disciplinary teams to understand/identify areas of opportunity driven by online data, usability feedback, market and user research and user-centric design principles. Champion the user by understanding their goals and behaviors, communicating their needs, and creating solutions to meet those needs while balancing desired business outcomes. Demonstrate the company's core values of respect, honesty, integrity, diversity, inclusion and safety.

Title: Product Designer
Job_Description:
Company Name: Kroger General Office
Position Type: Employee
FLSA Status: Exempt

Position Summary

Define the customer journey across multiple products. Demonstrate a deep understanding of the customer, initiate research studies to uncover specific customer problems, insights and opportunities. Partner with Product Management, Engineering, Marketing, Merchandising, and Data Scientists, along with designers across customer journeys and product teams to shape the product vision. Mentors Designers and associate designers. Demonstrate the company's core values of respect, honesty, integrity, diversity, inclusion and safety.

Title: Product Designer
Job_Description:
Company Name: Kroger General Office
Position Type: Employee
FLSA Status: Exempt

Position Summary

Manage a team of Product Designers. Drive product design initiatives, customer experience enhancements, and make individual contributions as needed. Has a deep understanding of the customer, and initiates research studies to uncover specific customer problems, insights and opportunities. Partner with Product Management, Engineering, Marketing, Merchandising and Data Scientists, along with Designers across customer journeys and product teams to shape the product vision. Evangelist of Product Design and ways of working. Demonstrate the company's core values of respect, honesty, integrity, diversity, inclusion and safety.

Title: Cyber Risk Analyst
Job_Description:
NSG, Inc. is currently hiring for a full time, IWMS Data Analyst for an office facility located in Blue Ash, OH. This position runs Mon-Fri from 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m. While the position will initially start as an in-person role at a facility in Blue Ash, may eventually turn into a hybrid schedule.
Primary Duties:
Consolidate data integration with HR, space, occupancy, and financial information.
Develop and maintain standard space reports to support data requests.
Identify and analyze data and trends to determine areas of opportunity for space utilization and space performance improvement, operational efficiency, and inventory improvements.
Integrate drawings, maps, and other information compatible with the existing information base including current releases and digitize and maintain information related to space planning.

Title: Cyber Risk Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Title: Sr. HRIS Analyst
Introduction:
Under the supervision of the Sr. Manager, a Sr. HRIS Analyst is responsible for supporting all aspects of the Learning Management System (LMS) and/or the HR systems and related interfaces for TGCS. As a Sr. HRIS Analyst, the individual will serve as a Technical Learning & Development expert to find process improvements and functionalities. This person will be responsible for assisting the development and implementation of process improvement initiatives related to the use of the LMS, HRIS applications, systems, reporting and tools. The HRIS Analyst will be assigned to one or more areas of support, systems, and will serve as backup to other team member/support areas/systems.
Responsibilities:

Title: Cyber Risk Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Title:
Technical Project Manager
Introduction:
The Technical Project Manager (PM) has the overall responsibility of ensuring project success by managing the project scope, resources, budget, and technical deliverables. While leading the teams of business analysts, software engineers, architects, and test engineers, the PM will oversee the design, development, test, deployment, maintenance, and improvement of the software products. The PM will also be an active participant in negotiating requirements with stakeholders, identifying risks, managing schedules, and communicating with the project stakeholders on a regular cadence. PMs will be responsible for monthly forecasting, as well as presenting on key engagements to upper management. As a Sr. PM, they will own their accounts and be responsible for all products/services delivered to their respective customers.

Title: Operations Engineer
Job_Description:
Company Name: Kroger General Office
Position Type: Employee
FLSA Status: Exempt
Line of Business:
See what life is like at Kroger Technology
at https://www.kroger.com/livekt

Additional Technology Information:
Skills and expectations:
On call duties
General technical understanding of web-hosted, customer-facing systems
Troubleshooting capability and experience
Strong communication and collaborations skills

The ideal candidate for this position is someone who will quickly learn complex item and pricing systems in order to provide a source of knowledge and documentation, lead incident calls, reduce time of impact for these events and work to mitigate issues that allow for repetitive occurrences.
Strong communication and collaboration skills are necessary as well as proven troubleshooting experience. Must be willing and able to work with a myriad of teams and positions as well as ability to competently speak to senior leadership levels.

General job functions:
Develop deep-level knowledge of Kroger's item and pricing systems, workflows, and processes
Interact with relevant teams responsible for these areas
Document workflows and teams involved
Work with ORE teams to streamline process and "level up"
Provide back-up support for similar roles within the team

Assist with reporting tasks
verify accuracy of User Experience tracking items
Preparation and delivery for SWAT meetings
Annual report requests

Facilitate major incident calls for MX
Join calls (24x7)
Assist Crisis Management and ORE in preparing for post-incident discussions
Proctor deep dive technical discussions for more complicated major incidents with ambiguous root cause
Keep senior management in the loop real-time on incidents (no surprises)

Change Management
Awareness of and preparation for upcoming changes
Coordinate with teams to avoid conflicts
Track high risk changes to completion

Problem Management
Tasks TBD as ServiceNow rolls out
Participate in PIR program

Support of lower environments
Work with Test team and ORE to develop resource-acceptable processes for mitigating major incidents in lower environments

Participate in bi-weekly ORE and period reviews
Recommend improvements to reports
Identify trends
Identify automation opportunities
Verify capable, mature ORE support in coordination with TCS partner

Plan and manage transition of any new ORE transition requests
Verify appropriate roles/responsibilities and timelines
Validate any additional staffing needs
Verify successful completion with partner teams

Title: Principal Research Engineer
Job_Description:
84.51° Overview:
84.51° is a retail data science, insights and media company. We help the Kroger company, consumer packaged goods companies, agencies, publishers and affiliated partners create more personalized and valuable experiences for shoppers across the path to purchase.
Powered by cutting edge science, we leverage 1st party retail data from nearly 1 of 2 US households and 2BN+ transactions to fuel a more customer-centric journey utilizing 84.51° Insights, 84.51° Loyalty Marketing and our retail media advertising solution, Kroger Precision Marketing.
Join us at 84.51°!

Job Title: Software Support Engineer
Introduction:

The Software Engineer will be working as a Level 2 Support Engineer for Toshiba Global Commerce Solutions and is a key role in providing hands on support of TGCS’s solutions for the retail customers. The level 2 Support Engineer provides services to retail clients worldwide to research, troubleshoot and deliver solutions. TGCS develops and delivers a wide array of custom software solutions for Point of Sales applications, self-checkout, and mobility solutions. The Level 2 Support Engineer provides ongoing technical support for all those solutions in an efficient and accurate manner. Responsibilities include working in geographically diverse cross functional teams to provide a process to resolve customer reported software and hardware problems for delivered products. The problems can be from customers, business partners, sales or field personnel via a Service Requests or other means. at https://www.kroger.com/livekt

Additional Technology Information:
Skills and expectations:
On call duties
General technical understanding of web-hosted, customer-facing systems
Troubleshooting capability and experience
Strong communication and collaborations skills

The ideal candidate for this position is someone who will quickly learn complex item and pricing systems in order to provide a source of knowledge and documentation, lead incident calls, reduce time of impact for these events and work to mitigate issues that allow for repetitive occurrences.
Strong communication and collaboration skills are necessary as well as proven troubleshooting experience. Must be willing and able to work with a myriad of teams and positions as well as ability to competently speak to senior leadership levels.

General job functions:
Develop deep-level knowledge of Kroger's item and pricing systems, workflows, and processes
Interact with relevant teams responsible for these areas
Document workflows and teams involved
Work with ORE teams to streamline process and "level up"
Provide back-up support for similar roles within the team

Assist with reporting tasks
verify accuracy of User Experience tracking items
Preparation and delivery for SWAT meetings
Annual report requests

Facilitate major incident calls for MX
Join calls (24x7)
Assist Crisis Management and ORE in preparing for post-incident discussions
Proctor deep dive technical discussions for more complicated major incidents with ambiguous root cause
Keep senior management in the loop real-time on incidents (no surprises)

Change Management
Awareness of and preparation for upcoming changes
Coordinate with teams to avoid conflicts
Track high risk changes to completion

Problem Management
Tasks TBD as ServiceNow rolls out
Participate in PIR program

Support of lower environments
Work with Test team and ORE to develop resource-acceptable processes for mitigating major incidents in lower environments

Participate in bi-weekly ORE and period reviews
Recommend improvements to reports
Identify trends
Identify automation opportunities
Verify capable, mature ORE support in coordination with TCS partner

Plan and manage transition of any new ORE transition requests
Verify appropriate roles/responsibilities and timelines
Validate any additional staffing needs
Verify successful completion with partner teams

Additional Technology Information: Senior Software Engineer - Customer Identity
Kroger's Customer Identity team's mission is to provide state of the art secure, low-friction, and
highly available authentication & authorization services for over 65 Million online shoppers. You
will be joining a team that is on a journey toward enabling passwordless auth, FIDO, and
passkeys.
You will be joining a CIAM (Customer Identity and Access Management) team that is highly
passionate about customer experience and developer experience. You will be responsible for
creating sign-up, login and identity management flows for Kroger applications (iOS, Android,
and Web). You will work on features such as multi factor auth with new device detection, code
challenge flows, and social sign in to provide a low friction and secure means of allowing
customers to access Kroger's services.

Title: Asset Protection Officer
Job_Description:
At Fred Meyer Clackamas warehouses we are looking for a highly engaged Asset Protection (AP) officer to be part of our team. AP officers oversee 100 acres complex that stretches a mile in length, and encompasses two warehouses, transportation and a manufacturing plant. This site services Fred Meyer and QFC stores in Oregon, SW Washington and Idaho as well as other Kroger locations across the nation. Our warehouses consist of dry grocery, frozen foods, meat, deli, produce, general merchandise. We have our own transportation trucking department and a bakery plant on site. AP Officers patrol on foot and in vehicle along with an investigation post and a static post. This is a very dynamic position with a lot of opportunity.
****Company Paid DPSST training and certifications****
Why you’ll love working with us:
DPSST Certification training provided

Title: Lead Azure Engineer
Job_Description:
Lead Azure Engineer
Location: Remote
Duration: Long Term
As an Azure Cloud Engineer, you will have the opportunity to act in the role of Subject Matter Expert within the Data Integration Engineering (DIE) department. You will own making architecture decisions made at the platform level, identify reusable patterns, and automate adoption to Azure services for multiple application teams within the DIE ecosystem. You will assist in design & implementation of cloud-native, well-architected solutions that integrate well into the existing Kroger systems. You will run the department’s Azure administration functions. You will also provide best practices on secure foundational cloud implementations, automated provisioning of infrastructure and applications, cloud-ready application architectures, and more. You will strive to continuously improve the software delivery processes & practices and be a role model to other engineers from application teams.

Title: Lead Azure Engineer
Job_Description:
Who We Are
Powering the next generation of customer interactions, Kitewheel is a cloud-based software platform, used by some of the world’s largest consumer brands (e.g. Kroger, US Bank, Synchrony Financial) to deliver real-time customer experiences. The business, led by a team of marketing and customer engagement tech veterans, is in its seventh year of operation and has grown an average of 100% every year. Kitewheel serves its global customer and partner base from offices in Boston (HQ), New York City, and London.
Forrester has named Kitewheel as the Leader in Customer Journey Orchestration and Analytics since 2017 and again for 2020. This followed being named a Visionary on Gartner’s 2016 Magic Quadrant for Digital Marketing Hubs, being honored as CRM Watchlist “Rookie of the Year” in 2015 and named by Gartner as a “Cool Vendor” in CRM Marketing in 2014.
The Kitewheel Development Team is a world class team of developers working on the world’s leading customer journey orchestration platform. We work hard, and we have fun.
